verses.text: And the famine \add was\add* sore in the land.
And it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn which they had brought out of Egypt , their father said unto them, Go again , buy us a little food.

And Judah spake unto him, saying , The man did solemnly protest unto us, saying , Ye shall not see my face , except your brother \add be\add* with you.\f + \fr 43.3 \ft did…: Heb. protesting protested\f*
If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food :
But if thou wilt not send \add him\add*, we will not go down : for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face , except your brother \add be\add* with you.
And Israel said , Wherefore dealt ye \add so\add* ill with me, \add as\add* to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother ?

And they said , The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred , saying , \add Is\add* your father yet alive ? have ye \add another\add* brother ? and we told him according to the tenor of these words : could we certainly know that he would say , Bring your brother down ?\f + \fr 43.7 \ft asked…: Heb. asking asked us\f*\f + \fr 43.7 \ft tenor: Heb. mouth\f*\f + \fr 43.7 \ft could…: Heb. knowing could we know\f*
And Judah said unto Israel his father , Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go ; that we may live , and not die , both we, and thou, \add and\add* also our little ones.
I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him: if I bring him not unto thee, and set him before thee , then let me bear the blame for ever :
For except we had lingered , surely now we had returned this second time.\f + \fr 43.10 \ft this: or, twice by this\f* \p

And their father Israel said unto them, If \add it must be\add* so now , do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your vessels , and carry down the man a present , a little balm , and a little honey , spices , and myrrh , nuts , and almonds :
And take double money in your hand ; and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks , carry \add it\add* again in your hand ; peradventure it \add was\add* an oversight :
Take also your brother , and arise , go again unto the man :

And God Almighty give you mercy before the man , that he may send away your other brother , and Benjamin. If I be bereaved \add of my children\add*, I am bereaved.\f + \fr 43.14 \ft If…: or, And I, as I have been, etc.\f* \p
¶ And the men took that present , and they took double money in their hand , and Benjamin ; and rose up , and went down to Egypt , and stood before Joseph.

And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his house , Bring \add these\add* men home , and slay , and make ready ; for \add these\add* men shall dine with me at noon.\f + \fr 43.16 \ft slay: Heb. kill a killing\f*\f + \fr 43.16 \ft dine: Heb. eat\f*
And the man did as Joseph bade ; and the man brought the men into Joseph’s house.

And the men were afraid , because they were brought into Joseph’s house ; and they said , Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in ; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen , and our asses.\f + \fr 43.18 \ft seek…: Heb. roll himself upon us\f*
And they came near to the steward of Joseph’s house , and they communed with him at the door of the house ,
And said , O sir , we came indeed down at the first time to buy food :\f + \fr 43.20 \ft we…: Heb. coming down we came down\f*

And it came to pass, when we came to the inn , that we opened our sacks , and, behold, \add every\add* man’s money \add was\add* in the mouth of his sack , our money in full weight : and we have brought it again in our hand.
And other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food : we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.

And he said , Peace \add be\add* to you, fear not: your God , and the God of your father , hath given you treasure in your sacks : I had your money. And he brought Simeon out unto them.\f + \fr 43.23 \ft I had…: Heb. your money came to me\f*
And the man brought the men into Joseph’s house , and gave \add them\add* water , and they washed their feet ; and he gave their asses provender.
And they made ready the present against Joseph came at noon : for they heard that they should eat bread there. \p
¶ And when Joseph came home , they brought him the present which \add was\add* in their hand into the house , and bowed themselves to him to the earth.

And he asked them of \add their\add* welfare , and said , \add Is\add* your father well , the old man of whom ye spake ? \add Is\add* he yet alive ?\f + \fr 43.27 \ft welfare: Heb. peace\f*\f + \fr 43.27 \ft Is your…: Heb. Is there peace to your father?\f*
And they answered , Thy servant our father \add is\add* in good health , he \add is\add* yet alive. And they bowed down their heads , and made obeisance.

And he lifted up his eyes , and saw his brother Benjamin , his mother’s son , and said , \add Is\add* this your younger brother , of whom ye spake unto me? And he said , God be gracious unto thee, my son.
And Joseph made haste ; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother : and he sought \add where\add* to weep ; and he entered into \add his\add* chamber , and wept there.
And he washed his face , and went out , and refrained himself, and said , Set on bread.

And they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians , which did eat with him, by themselves: because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews ; for that \add is\add* an abomination unto the Egyptians.
And they sat before him , the firstborn according to his birthright , and the youngest according to his youth : and the men marvelled one at another.

And he took \add and sent\add* messes unto them from before him : but Benjamin’s mess was five times so much as any of theirs. And they drank , and were merry with him.\f + \fr 43.34 \ft were…: Heb. drank largely\f*
